title: Fortescue Metals Extends Share Buyback Program
text:
By Rhiannon Hoyle

SYDNEY--Fortescue Metals Group Ltd. (FMG.AU) will extend its on-market share buyback for a further year, during which the mining company might repurchase up to 500 million Australian dollars (US$338 million) in stock, it said Friday.

Fortescue started a A$500-million buyback program in October 2018, although in August said it had only bought 34.8 million shares, costing a total A$139.2 million or an average A$3.997 per share. That program was due to end this month.

"Fortescue may now buy back up to A$500 million of shares" during the year ahead, although "the number of shares purchased and timing of the buy-back will depend on Fortescue's share price and market conditions," the miner said.

Fortescue's shares have more than doubled in value this year, underpinned by a surge in prices for iron ore, the only commodity it produces.
